    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF IN video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<span class="line"><!---->UAF IN video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->Reproduce<!----></span><br>The problem was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <span class="line"><!---->The problem was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>It cannot be reproduced stably, CF may not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->It cannot be reproduced stably, CF may not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>RCA<span class="line"><!---->RCA<!----></span><br>1. VideoSourceImpl owns device_ through a raw_ptr, but doesn't properly observe its lifetime<span class="line"><!---->1. VideoSourceImpl owns device_ through a raw_ptr, but doesn't properly observe its lifetime<!----></span><br>2. If device_ is freed it will cause VideoSourceImpl to trigger a security issue when accessed<span class="line"><!---->2. If device_ is freed it will cause VideoSourceImpl to trigger a security issue when accessed<!----></span><br>3. device_ may get freed when OnClientDisconnected get call[1]<span class="line"><!---->3. device_ may get freed when OnClientDisconnected get call[1]<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() {<span connection with VideoSourceImpl client.<!----></span><br>  if (device_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (device_)<!----></span><br>    device_->StopInProcess();					<<***[1]***<span class="line"><!----> callback may synchronously trigger the destruction of<span class="line"><!---->    // Note: Invoking this callback may synchronously trigger the destruction of<!----></span><br>    // |this|, so no more member access should be done after it.<span class="line"><!---->    // |this|, so no more member access should be done after it.<!----></span><br>    on_last_binding_closed_cb_.Run();<span class="line"><!---->    on_last_binding_closed_cb_.Run();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span sp 0x7ffe3f659840 T0)<span class="line"><!---->==751187==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address (pc 0x55abd3c8ecd2 bp 0x7ffe3f6598b0 sp 0x7ffe3f659840 T0)<!----></span><br>==751187==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span class="line"><!---->==751187==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<!----></span><br>==751187==Hint: this fault was caused by a dereference of a         I think the root cause of the issue is incorrect use of raw_ptr( assign raw_ptr<T> memory directly)[1].<span class="line"><!---->I think the root cause of the issue is incorrect use of raw_ptr( assign raw_ptr&lt;T&gt; memory directly)[1].<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoSourceImpl::OnCreateDeviceResponse(<span class="line"><!---->void VideoSourceImpl::OnCreateDeviceResponse(<!----></span><br>    std::unique_ptr<ScopedCaptureTrace> scoped_trace,<span class="line"><!---->    std::unique_ptr&lt;ScopedCaptureTrace&gt; scoped_trace,<!----></span><br>    DeviceInProcessInfo info) {<span class="line"><!---->    DeviceInProcessInfo info) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<!----></span><br><br>  if (info.result_code == media::VideoCaptureError::kNone) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (info.result_code == media::VideoCaptureError::kNone) {<!----></span><br>    if (scoped_trace)<span class="line"><!---->    if (scoped_trace)<!----></span><br>      scoped_trace->AddStep("StartDevice");<span class="line"><!---->      scoped_trace-&gt;AddStep("StartDevice");<!----></span><br><br>    // Device was created successfully.<span class="line"><!---->    // Device was created successfully.<!----></span><br>    device_ = info.device;<<***1***<span class="line"><!---->    device_ = info.device;&lt;&lt;***1***<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Reading raw_ptr.md you can see that this usage is explicitly forbidden because it will result in undefined behavior<span class="line"><!---->Reading raw_ptr.md you can see that this usage is explicitly forbidden because it will result in undefined behavior<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Don’t initialize or assign raw_ptr<T> memory directly (e.g. reinterpret_cast<ClassWithRawPtr*>(buffer) or memcpy(reinterpret_cast<void*>(&obj_with_raw_ptr), buffer).<span class="line"><!---->Don’t initialize or assign raw_ptr&lt;T&gt; memory directly (e.g. reinterpret_cast&lt;ClassWithRawPtr*&gt;(buffer) or memcpy(reinterpret_cast&lt;void*&gt;(&amp;obj_with_raw_ptr), buffer).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hello, thanks for this question. Unfortunately, we cannot extend a fuzzer bonus for this report. The expectations around fuzzer bonuses is that the fuzzer and testcase being run on ClusterFuzz is able to automatically submit a report, including an automatic bisect, potential owner cc/ assignment, and identifying regression range (if applicable) - fairly automated triage, without human / manual intervention needed to submit the report and then to triage it.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thanks for this question. Unfortunately, we cannot extend a fuzzer bonus for this report. The expectations around fuzzer bonuses is that the fuzzer and testcase being run on ClusterFuzz is able to automatically submit a report, including an automatic bisect, potential owner cc/ assignment, and identifying regression range (if applicable) - fairly automated triage, without human / manual intervention needed to submit the report and then to triage it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF IN video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<span class="line"><!---->UAF IN video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->Reproduce<!----></span><br>The problem was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <span class="line"><!---->The problem was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>It cannot be reproduced stably, CF may not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->It cannot be reproduced stably, CF may not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>RCA<span class="line"><!---->RCA<!----></span><br>1. VideoSourceImpl owns device_ through a raw_ptr, but doesn't properly observe its lifetime<span class="line"><!---->1. VideoSourceImpl owns device_ through a raw_ptr, but doesn't properly observe its lifetime<!----></span><br>2. If device_ is freed it will cause VideoSourceImpl to trigger a security issue when accessed<span class="line"><!---->2. If device_ is freed it will cause VideoSourceImpl to trigger a security issue when accessed<!----></span><br>3. device_ may get freed when OnClientDisconnected get call[1]<span class="line"><!---->3. device_ may get freed when OnClientDisconnected get call[1]<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() {<span class="line"><!---->void VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<!----></span><br><br>  // Stop |device_| when lose connection with VideoSourceImpl client.<span class="line"><!---->  // Stop |device_| when lose connection with VideoSourceImpl client.<!----></span><br>  if (device_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (device_)<!----></span><br>    device_->StopInProcess();					<<***[1]***<span class="line"><!---->    device_-&gt;StopInProcess();					&lt;&lt;***[1]***<!----></span><br><br>  if (receivers_.empty()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (receivers_.empty()) {<!----></span><br>    // Note: Invoking this callback may synchronously trigger the destruction of<span class="line"><!---->    // Note: Invoking this callback may synchronously trigger the destruction of<!----></span><br>    // |this|, so no more member access should be done after it.<span class="line"><!---->    // |this|, so no more member access should be done after it.<!----></span><br>    on_last_binding_closed_cb_.Run();<span class="line"><!---->    on_last_binding_closed_cb_.Run();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>ASAN<span class="line"><!---->ASAN<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==751187==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address (pc 0x55abd3c8ecd2 bp 0x7ffe3f6598b0 sp 0x7ffe3f659840 T0)<span class="line"><!---->==751187==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address (pc 0x55abd3c8ecd2 bp 0x7ffe3f6598b0 sp 0x7ffe3f659840 T0)<!----></span><br>==751187==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span class="line"><!---->==751187==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<!----></span><br>==751187==Hint: this fault was caused by a dereference of a high value address (see register values below).  Disassemble the provided pc to learn which register was used.<span class="line"><!---->==751187==Hint: this fault was caused by a dereference of a high value address (see register values below).  Disassemble the provided pc to learn which register was used.<!----></span><br>SCARINESS: 20 (wild-addr-read)<span class="line"><!---->SCARINESS: 20 (wild-addr-read)<!----></span><br>    #0 0x55abd3c8ecd2 in video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x55abd3c8ecd2 in video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<!----></span><br>    #1 0x55abd3c91a6f in Invoke<void (video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::*)(), video_capture::VideoSourceImpl *> base/functional/bind_internal.h:646:12<span class="line"><!---->    #1 0x55abd3c91a6f in Invoke&lt;void (video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::*)(), video_capture::VideoSourceImpl *&gt; base/functional/bind_internal.h:646:12<!----></span><br>    #2 0x55abd3c91a6f in MakeItSo<void (video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::*const &)(), const std::Cr::tuple<base::internal::UnretainedWrapper<video_capture::VideoSourceImpl, base::RawPtrBanDanglingIfSupported> > &> base/functional/bind_internal.h:825:12<span class="line"><!---->    #2 0x55abd3c91a6f in MakeItSo&lt;void (video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::*const &amp;)(), const std::Cr::tuple&lt;base::internal::UnretainedWrapper&lt;video_capture::VideoSourceImpl,       </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think the root cause of the issue is incorrect use of raw_ptr( assign raw_ptr<T> memory directly)[1].<span class="line"><!---->I think the root cause of the issue is incorrect use of raw_ptr( assign raw_ptr&lt;T&gt; memory directly)[1].<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoSourceImpl::OnCreateDeviceResponse(<span class="line"><!---->void VideoSourceImpl::OnCreateDeviceResponse(<!----></span><br>    std::unique_ptr<ScopedCaptureTrace> scoped_trace,<span class="line"><!---->    std::unique_ptr&lt;ScopedCaptureTrace&gt; scoped_trace,<!----></span><br>    DeviceInProcessInfo info) {<span class="line"><!---->    DeviceInProcessInfo info) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<!----></span><br><br>  if (info.result_code == media::VideoCaptureError::kNone) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (info.result_code == media::VideoCaptureError::kNone) {<!----></span><br>    if (scoped_trace)<span class="line"><!---->    if (scoped_trace)<!----></span><br>      scoped_trace->AddStep("StartDevice");<span class="line"><!---->      scoped_trace-&gt;AddStep("StartDevice");<!----></span><br><br>    // Device was created successfully.<span class="line"><!---->    // Device was created successfully.<!----></span><br>    device_ = info.device;<<***1***<span class="line"><!---->    device_ = info.device;&lt;&lt;***1***<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Reading raw_ptr.md you can see that this usage is explicitly forbidden because it will result in undefined behavior<span class="line"><!---->Reading raw_ptr.md you can see that this usage is explicitly forbidden because it will result in undefined behavior<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Don’t initialize or assign raw_ptr<T> memory directly (e.g. reinterpret_cast<ClassWithRawPtr*>(buffer) or memcpy(reinterpret_cast<void*>(&obj_with_raw_ptr), buffer).<span class="line"><!---->Don’t initialize or assign raw_ptr&lt;T&gt; memory directly (e.g. reinterpret_cast&lt;ClassWithRawPtr*&gt;(buffer) or memcpy(reinterpret_cast&lt;void*&gt;(&amp;obj_with_raw_ptr), buffer).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

<span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>02cdf461547f293914584f7c08eb342730f0e6ed<a class="undefined" target="_blank" &lt;<!----></span>zhaoliang.ma@intel.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/zhaoliang.ma@intel.com"><!---->zhaoliang.ma@intel.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Nov 15 01:29:27 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Nov 15 01:29:27 2022<!----></span><br><br>services/video_capture: Stop Device from DeviceFactory to avoid UaF<span class="line"><!---->services/video_capture: Stop Device from DeviceFactory to avoid UaF<!----></span><br><br>Device should call Stop() when VideoSource remote is discarded with active PushSubscription, this CL doing this by calling DeviceFactory for safety.<span class="line"><!---->Device should call Stop() when VideoSource remote is discarded with active PushSubscription, this CL doing this by calling DeviceFactory for safety.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1383442<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1383442"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hello, thanks for this question. Unfortunately, we cannot extend a fuzzer bonus for this report. The expectations around fuzzer bonuses is that the fuzzer and testcase being run on ClusterFuzz is able to automatically submit a report, including an automatic bisect, potential owner cc/ assignment, and identifying regression range (if applicable) - fairly automated triage, without human / manual intervention needed to submit the report and then to triage it.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thanks for this question. Unfortunately, we cannot extend a fuzzer bonus for this report. The expectations around fuzzer bonuses is that the fuzzer and testcase being run on ClusterFuzz is able to automatically submit a report, including an automatic bisect, potential owner cc/ assignment, and identifying regression range (if applicable) - fairly automated triage, without human / manual intervention needed to submit the report and then to triage it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          Security_Impact-Head<a class="label" title="Security_Impact-Head = Security bug in HEAD/trunk/tip-of-tree" href="/p/chromium/issues/list?q=label:Security_Impact-Head"><!---->Security_Impact-Head<!----></a>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>UAF IN video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<span class="line"><!---->UAF IN video_capture::VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc:88:14<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Reproduce<span class="line"><!---->Reproduce<!----></span><br>The problem was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <span class="line"><!---->The problem was found by my fuzzer running on CF(CC Security team for access permission <!----></span>https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896"><!---->https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase-detail/5927304757968896<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>It cannot be reproduced stably, CF may not automatically report.<span class="line"><!---->It cannot be reproduced stably, CF may not automatically report.<!----></span><br><br>RCA<span class="line"><!---->RCA<!----></span><br>1. VideoSourceImpl owns device_ through a raw_ptr, but doesn't properly observe its lifetime<span class="line"><!---->1. VideoSourceImpl owns device_ through a raw_ptr, but doesn't properly observe its lifetime<!----></span><br>2. If device_ is freed it will cause VideoSourceImpl to trigger a security issue when accessed<span class="line"><!---->2. If device_ is freed it will cause VideoSourceImpl to trigger a security issue when accessed<!----></span><br>3. device_ may get freed when OnClientDisconnected get call[1]<span class="line"><!---->3. device_ may get freed when OnClientDisconnected get call[1]<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoSourceImpl::OnClientDisconnected() {<span connection with VideoSourceImpl client.<!----></span><br>  if (device_)<span class="line"><!---->  if (device_)<!----></span><br>    device_->StopInProcess();					<<***[1]***<span class="line"><!---->    device_-&gt;StopInProcess();					&lt;&lt;***[1]***<!----></span><br><br>  if (receivers_.empty()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (receivers_.empty()) {<!----></span><br>    // Note: Invoking this callback may synchronously trigger the destruction of<span class="line"><!---->    // Note: Invoking this callback may synchronously trigger the destruction of<!----></span><br>    // |this|, so no more member access should be done after it.<span class="line"><!---->    // |this|, so no more member access should be done after it.<!----></span><br>    on_last_binding_closed_cb_.Run();<span class="line"><!---->    on_last_binding_closed_cb_.Run();<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>ASAN<span class="line"><!---->ASAN<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==751187==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address (pc 0x55abd3c8ecd2 bp 0x7ffe3f6598b0 sp 0x7ffe3f659840 T0)<span class="line"><!---->==751187==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: SEGV on unknown address (pc 0x55abd3c8ecd2 bp 0x7ffe3f6598b0 sp 0x7ffe3f659840 T0)<!----></span><br>==751187==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<span class="line"><!---->==751187==The signal is caused by a READ memory access.<!----></span><br>==751187==Hint: this fault was caused by a dereference of a high value address (see register values below).         I think the root cause of the issue is incorrect use of raw_ptr( assign raw_ptr<T> memory directly)[1].<span class="line"><!---->I think the root cause of the issue is incorrect use of raw_ptr( assign raw_ptr&lt;T&gt; memory directly)[1].<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/video_capture/video_source_impl.cc;drc=5a691c7c1c46421b2fa7ff3cd3b5f79470ed3808;l=124<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>void VideoSourceImpl::OnCreateDeviceResponse(<span class="line"><!---->void VideoSourceImpl::OnCreateDeviceResponse(<!----></span><br>    std::unique_ptr<ScopedCaptureTrace> scoped_trace,<span class="line"><!---->    std::unique_ptr&lt;ScopedCaptureTrace&gt; scoped_trace,<!----></span><br>    DeviceInProcessInfo info) {<span class="line"><!---->    DeviceInProcessInfo info) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE(sequence_checker_);<!----></span><br><br>  if (info.result_code == media::VideoCaptureError::kNone) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (info.result_code == media::VideoCaptureError::kNone) {<!----></span><br>    if (scoped_trace)<span class="line"><!---->    if (scoped_trace)<!----></span><br>      scoped_trace->AddStep("StartDevice");<span class="line"><!---->      scoped_trace-&gt;AddStep("StartDevice");<!----></span><br><br>    // Device was created successfully.<span class="line"><!---->    // Device was created successfully.<!----></span><br>    device_ = info.device;<<***1***<span class="line"><!---->    device_ = info.device;&lt;&lt;***1***<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Reading raw_ptr.md you can see that this usage is explicitly forbidden because it will result in undefined behavior<span class="line"><!---->Reading raw_ptr.md you can see that this usage is explicitly forbidden because it will result in undefined behavior<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/base/memory/raw_ptr.md#extra-pointer-rules<!----></a><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>Don’t initialize or assign raw_ptr<T> memory directly (e.g. reinterpret_cast<ClassWithRawPtr*>(buffer) or memcpy(reinterpret_cast<void*>(&obj_with_raw_ptr), buffer).<span class="line"><!---->Don’t initialize or assign raw_ptr&lt;T&gt; memory directly (e.g. reinterpret_cast&lt;ClassWithRawPtr*&gt;(buffer) or memcpy(reinterpret_cast&lt;void*&gt;(&amp;obj_with_raw_ptr), buffer).<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products.         Hello, thanks for this question. Unfortunately, we cannot extend a fuzzer bonus for this report. The expectations around fuzzer bonuses is that the fuzzer and testcase being run on ClusterFuzz is able to automatically submit a report, including an automatic bisect, potential owner cc/ assignment, and identifying regression range (if applicable) - fairly automated triage, without human / manual intervention needed to submit the report and then to triage it.<span class="line"><!---->Hello, thanks for this question. Unfortunately, we cannot extend a fuzzer bonus for this report. The expectations around fuzzer bonuses is that the fuzzer and testcase being run on ClusterFuzz is able to automatically submit a report, including an automatic bisect, potential owner cc/ assignment, and identifying regression range (if applicable) - fairly automated triage, without human / manual intervention needed to submit the report and then to triage it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<span class="line"><!---->2. Is this issue related to a change or feature merged after the latest LTS Milestone?<!----></span><br><br><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
